entities.description: An address-based sampling frame used for selecting a portion of the sample segments.
A geographic unit used for evaluating the sample coverage criteria for the survey.
A geographic area for which the DU frame is constructed, including both ABS and field enumeration segments.
A method used when census blocks fail to meet coverage criteria, involving smaller areas or census blocks.
The design allowing for estimates by state and a sufficient sample size at state and substate levels.
The impact of COVID-19 on the survey design and methodology, including multimode data collection adjustments.
Data collection through a combination of web and in-person methods, used due to COVID-19.
Additional samples selected from prior NSDUH samples for the third quarter to ensure target sample sizes.

relationships.description: The survey uses an address-based sampling frame for selecting segments.
The ABS approach evaluates census block groups against coverage criteria.
The survey contains segments which are specific geographic areas regarding sampling.
Field enumeration is required when census block groups fail to meet coverage criteria.
The sample design is for ensuring sufficient sample sizes at varying state and substate levels.
The survey design and methodology are affected by the impact of COVID-19.
The impact of COVID-19 led to the implementation of multimode data collection.
The supplemental sample ensures the target sample size is met.
